posts.post_content: This card is a staple in my favorite blue white control deck. This card hits the field by turn 3 and my friends all groan and curse. Ah... such a good feeling. This is the only wall card I've ever played that literally feels like something safe to hide behind.

Posted By: Virens (8/8/2010 7:16:16 PM)
Rating:

Who would have guessed that a wall would get a rating of 4 1/2 stars?
It's an awesome wall for sure, stopping even the most broken of of Turn 2-3 attackers (where's your Abyssal Persecutor now?

@Scumbling: Buying time is a critical aspect of the game. Nobody said that I was playing walls instead of game-winning spells and abilities. Reliably and repeatedly buying time isn't good on it's own, and filling a deck with only that results in a lot of slow defeats. But if you buy time efficiently and early enough, it gives you more time to ramp mana and drop those finishers, because ramping and playing creatures takes up time, and this has unprecedented delaying power at a relatively manageable cost. On top of all that, a lot of decks burn themselves out quickly, if they can't get through those first few turns. Defenders repeatedly thwart their attempts at getting through, which means that after they've emptied their hand, all they can do is wait for you to draw your f... (see all)

posts.post_content:
This would be much more popular if [Liliana of the Veil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana of the Veil) didn't eat up tournies so often. Between her, Pulse, Putrefy, and Abrupt Decay it's very hard to keep stuff on the board against B/G aggro.  
  
What's worse is that T1 and T2 also look the same as Pod making it difficult to see what's coming.

Posted By: blurrymadness (7/24/2013 10:56:47 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: As far as walls go, this is about one of the best ever printed in magic. Maybe the Wall of Omens/Blossoms is better for drawing cards, and there's a wall that gains a little bit of life unless things are getting pretty bad, but as far as walls go doing what walls should be doing, this is probably the best one I can think of. It will probably save you 10-50 life over the course of a game.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
@Shadoflaam  
You can bring an aura back from the graveyard and stick it on shrouded creatures.   
Or cheat it into play with [Show and Tell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Show and Tell), [Braids, Conjurer Adept](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Braids, Conjurer Adept), etc.  
  
That way you get around targeting the creatures you want to "equip" (attach) the aura to.
posts.html:
@Shadoflaam
You can bring an aura back from the graveyard and stick it on shrouded creatures.
Or cheat it into play with Show and Tell, Braids, Conjurer Adept, etc.

That way you get around targeting the creatures you want to "equip" (attach) the aura to.
